review_blob:
Fresh from a can purchased at the brewery. 

Outstanding IPA. Huge hoppy aroma with a lovely orange amber colour. Well balanced with solid mouth feel while hiding the 6.8% alcohol.
Solid stout with a lightly carbonated smooth mouth feel. Well balanced with the usual stout notes.

On tap at Bar Volo.

This was a great beer, the best I had that night of many from the vast Bar Volo taplist.

Growler from the brewery. This is a really bitter and astringent IPA with not a lot of the fruit flavours found in top notch IPAs. But other than that it is really well done. The alcohol is well hidden with a creamy texture.
beer_name: Beyond the Pale Ball Dropper IPA

review_blob: Bomber from the brewery. Solid stout with the alcohol well hidden for such a big beer.
Bottle from the LCBO. Pours dark dark brown with a litle beige head. Well incorporated coffee with a hoppy background. A smooth silky mouthfeel that hide the 8.3% alcohol pretty well.
Growler from the brewery. The freshness from the hops really comes through.
beer_name: Beyond the Pale Drink Me Now

review_blob:
Bottle from Bieres du Monde but Ive tried it on tap at Mondiale. 

Really damn good. Pours a pale gold. Lots of sweet hop aroma. Creamy. Hoppy. Fruity. Bitter but with a balanced sweetness. Very complex.
beer_name: Dieu du Ciel / The Alchemist Moralit

review_blob: Tasted as a sample at the brewery. Decent american pale ale that I liked better than the version of Wildcard I sampled at the same time.

Strange combination. Dont really pick up the coffee but it doesnt taste like a standard IPA. Really unusual aroma. 

It still works though.

I like this quite a bit even though its a Belgian IIPA that doesnt really bring the Belgian or the Imperial. But maybe thats why I like it. 

This just does not taste like 9%.

Really outstanding APA.  Pours a hazy yellow.  Lots of fruity hop flavour and aroma.  Ive had this both in bottles and on tap and both versions are outstanding.  

Perfect beer for when you want something with a lower ABV than an IPA.
beer_name: Nickel Brook Naughty Neighbour American Pale Ale

review_blob: I liked this a lot.  Lots of hop flavour and the best IPA brewed in the region.  Like all of their beers it could use more carbonation.   Id also prefer if the alcohol was toned down a tad since it wasnt hidden.
beer_name: Beyond the Pale Hop on Your Face

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: This tastes like a Christmas tree in a glass.  Interesting attempt but its not for me.
On tap at Sir John A Pub.  Very little head and didnt pick up any aroma.  Thick full body and I picked up pineapple, mango and apple flavours but no pine flavours.
beer_name: Muskoka Twice As Mad Tom IPA

review_blob: Poured from a bottle.  Tiny head.  Almost pitch black colour.  One of the least hoppy black IPAs Ive tried.  Nice stout flavours but nothing exceptional.

From a growler poured the the day before at the brewery.   Rather faint aroma. Hazy light orange colour with a thin head.   Lightly carbonated.  The grapefruit flavour is rather subtle and makes this resemble an APA.  Itll make a nice summer beer.

Great smell with all the usual American IPA aromas.  Hazy golden colour with a tall thin head that dissipates quickly.  Could use more carbonation but has solid citrus and pine flavours with a rye backbone.
Pale yellow with a thin head.  Tastes like a tart sweet and sour saison.  I dont really taste any rauchbier characteristics.
Solid amber colour.  Big white head.  Sweet aroma of oak.  Very sweet and oaky.
Massive huge head. Clear light golden colour.   Less hoppy than expected from an IPA.
Huge head. Sweet floral aroma. Taste is an interesting mix of sweet, sour, tart and astringent.   Might work better in the summer than as a Christmas beer.
beer_name: Dunham / Kissmeyer La Rsurrection de Broderus

review_blob: 473 ml can.  Nice citrus flavour with bready malts and hoppy bitterness.
beer_name: Great Lakes Brewing Canuck Pale Ale

review_blob: 341mL bottle.   Strong tart raspberry taste with very little sweetness.  Great summer beer.
beer_name: Dieu du Ciel Solstice dt aux Framboises

review_blob: 341mL bottle.  Aroma is floral and citrus.  Huge grapefuit and pine flavour.  Very drinkable.
341mL bottle.  Nice golden colour.  Good hoppy, citrus flavour with a malt ybackground.
341mL bottle. Great combination of a spicy herbal triple with a hoppy IPA.
341mL bottle. Pours dark black.  Really hoppy.  More like an IPA than a stout.  Alcohol well hidden.  Much better than their regular Black IPA.
341mL bottle. Pours dark black.  Nice balance between a stout and a hoppy IPA.
341 ml bottle from Depanneur Rapido.  Strong aroma of fruit.  Beautiful golden orange colour.   Strong fruit flavour mixed with the slight bitterness from the tea.
beer_name: Dunham / Kissmeyer Leos Early Breakfast IPA
